result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L McKinney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow throught with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victim or any of the witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber) with standard release conditions (to include work and childcare).  Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 05:00 p.m. on 02-10-2016.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Count 1, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

Sentencing hearing at 02-03-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Reginald L McKinney in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Conditions of bail remain.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

From Atty Weitzner dated 12/7/15 withdrawing motion and request to have motion hearing changed to plea and sentencing.

Defendant Reginald L McKinney in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner advises the Court he plans to file a motion to suppress. Attorney Weitzner to file a motion by the end of the week.  The State to file any response by December 11, 2015.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 11-23-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Reginald L McKinney in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Weitner has received discovery and pretrial offer.   The Courts set the matter out in approximately 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 10-21-2015 11:00 am

Defendant to have no contact with any witnesses or the business (Wente Davidson) listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
